result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:24 PM Defendant Michael J Jakubiak appeared by video, in custody from the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Michael J Jakubiak. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he/she can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his/her attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he/she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his/her attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

3:25 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Jambois. 

3:26 p.m.   Detective Stormy Poeschel is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Jambois.
Witness identifies the defendant.
Atty Kryshak stipulates to the identification for today's hearing only.
3:27 p.m.   ADA Jambois references exhibit #P1. 
ADA Jambois would offer Exhibit #P1 into evidence subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Kryshak.  Received by the Court.
3:33 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Kryshak.
3:34 p.m.  ADA Jambois had no redirect.
ADA Jambois has no further witnesses.
Atty Kryshak has no witnesses.
ADA Jambois gives brief argument.
Atty Kryshak gives no argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J Jakubiak appeared by video, in custody. 

Atty Mutchler states the appearances. 
Court reviews the file.  Indicates the public defender still has not found counsel to appoint for the defendant. Questions the defendant if he would like to continue the matter to have counsel present. 
Defendant states yes. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds good cause to continue this matter to another date. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint. 
Defendant waives the reading of the complaint.

1:00 PM Defendant Michael Jakubiak appeared by video, in custody, from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for the Defendant Michael Jakubiak.
Atty Pfeil calls the case and states the appearances. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of first degree child sexual assault.  
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $75,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner states objections for cash bond for reasons stated on record.
Atty Bergner requests a signature bond.

Initial appearance to be set.
Atty Bergner has no objections.
